Content:: Browneichthys Woodward, 1899[2] Coccolepis is an extinct genus of prehistoric ray-finned fish in the family Coccolepididae. Originally including most species within the family, it is now restricted to two species from the Late Jurassic Solnhofen Limestone of Germany.[3] The holotype of C. bucklandi, designated and described by Louis Agassiz, was thought to be lost but was later rediscovered in Neuch√¢tel.[4] Some species originally referred to Coccolepis were later reallocated to other genera:  This article about a prehistoric ray-finned fish is a stub.
